ppelin/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x480d1a58ff73b9511d8876f0126be6557329fa3047843c4b726b71ff384d3469","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5a7ce447843ad1316139b80f1a819865f7934ba8595f9c22d091bb1a7ac1719b","dweb:/ipfs/QmQEVU7MESLW5QfvvUhisrs62o7C1yoEChtmvXdXhFUTQK"]}},"version":1}

documentation.text:
@title Lockable token with exceptions
 @dev Standard burnable ERC20 token modified with pausable transfers.
Flag for locking normal trading
Addresses exempted from token trade lock
@notice Admin function to lock trading
@notice Admin function to unlock trading
@dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is not paused.
@notice ERC20 transfer only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 transferFrom only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 approve only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 increaseAllowance only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 decreaseAllowance only when token is unlocked

@title Lockable token with exceptions
 @dev Standard burnable ERC20 token modified with pausable transfers.
Flag for locking normal trading
Addresses exempted from token trade lock
@notice Admin function to lock trading
@notice Admin function to unlock trading
@dev Modifier to make a function callable only when the contract is not paused.
@notice ERC20 transfer only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 transferFrom only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 approve only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 increaseAllowance only when token is unlocked
@notice ERC20 decreaseAllowance only when token is unlocked

devdoc.details: Standard burnable ERC20 token modified with pausable transfers.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

params.sender: The address attempting to make a transfer

returns._0: True if `sender` is allowed to make transfers, false otherwise

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.sender: The address to change the lock exception for

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.title: Lockable token with exceptions

approve(address,uint256).notice: ERC20 approve only when token is unlocked

canTrade(address).notice: Check if the token is currently tradable for `sender`

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: ERC20 decreaseAllowance only when token is unlocked

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: ERC20 increaseAllowance only when token is unlocked

lockExceptions(address).notice: Addresses exempted from token trade lock

setTradeException(address,bool).notice: Set whether `sender` may trade when token is locked

transfer(address,uint256).notice: ERC20 transfer only when token is unlocked

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: ERC20 transferFrom only when token is unlocked
